meanings.definition: A line of animals or slaves fastened or driven along together.
meanings.sent1: The coffle of elephants marched through the jungle.
meanings.sent2: The coffle of slaves trudged wearily under the scorching sun.
meanings.sent3: The coffle of ducks waddled in a comical parade.
meanings.sent4: The coffle of stars twinkled brightly in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The coffle of ants moved in perfect unison, a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: To fasten or drive animals or slaves in a line.
meanings.sent1: The farmer had to coffle the cows to the new pasture.
meanings.sent2: The slave driver would coffle the captives tightly together.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to coffle their toys in a row for a game.
meanings.sent4: The wind seemed to coffle the leaves into a swirling dance.
meanings.sent5: The music coffled the audience into a synchronized clap.
